participant_id.Description: Unique BIDS identifier for the participant in this study.

tbi_1.Description: Has your child ever been hospitalized or treated in an emergency room following an injury to his/her head or neck? ¿Alguna vez han hospitalizado a su niño/a o le han tratado en una sala de emergencias después de sufrir una lesión en la cabeza o en el cuello? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_1b.Description: Was he/she knocked out or did he/she lose consciousness (LOC)? If yes, how long? ¿Estuvo él o ella noqueado/a o perdió el conocimiento? ¿Si la respuesta es si, por cuánto tiempo? | 0 = No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento; 1 = < 30min < 30min; 2 = 30min-24hrs 30min-24hrs; 3 = >24 hrs >24 hrs

Levels.0: No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_1c.Description: Was he/she dazed or did he/she have a gap in his/her memory from the injury? ¿Se sintió él/ella aturdido, o tuvo lapsos de memoria  por causa de la lesión? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_1d.Description: How old was he/she? ¿Qué edad tenía?

tbi_2.Description: Has your child ever injured his/her head or neck in a car accident or from crashing some other moving vehicle like a bicycle, motorcyle, or ATV? ¿Su niño/a alguna vez se ha lastimado la cabeza o el cuello en un accidente de auto o por chocar cuando iba en algún otro vehículo en movimiento, como una bicicleta, motocicleta o vehículo todo terreno? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_2b.Description: Was he/she knocked out or did he/she lose consciousness (LOC)? If yes, how long? ¿Estuvo él o ella noqueado/a o perdió el conocimiento? ¿Si la respuesta es si, por cuánto tiempo? | 0 = No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento; 1 = < 30min < 30min; 2 = 30min-24hrs 30min-24hrs; 3 = >24 hrs >24 hrs

Levels.0: No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_2c.Description: Was he/she dazed or did he/she have a gap in his/her memory from the injury? ¿Se sintió él/ella aturdido, o tuvo lapsos de memoria  por causa de la lesión? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_2d.Description: How old was he/she? ¿Qué edad tenía?

tbi_3.Description: Has you child ever injured his/her head or neck in a fall or from being hit by something? (For example, falling from a bike or horse, rollerblading, falling on ice, being hit by a rock) Has your child ever injured his/her head or neck playing sports or on the playground? ¿Su niño/a alguna vez se ha lastimado la cabeza o el cuello en una caída o porque algo le haya caído en la cabeza (p. ej., al caerse de una bicicleta o un caballo, al andar en patines, al caerse en el hielo o que le haya caído una roca)? ¿Su niño(a) alguna vez se ha lastimado la cabeza o el cuello haciendo deporte o jugando en un parque? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_3b.Description: Was he/she knocked out or did he/she lose consciousness (LOC)? If yes, how long? ¿Estuvo él o ella noqueado/a o perdió el conocimiento? ¿Si la respuesta es si, por cuánto tiempo? | 0 = No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento; 1 = < 30min < 30min; 2 = 30min-24hrs 30min-24hrs; 3 = >24 hrs >24 hrs

Levels.0: No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_3c.Description: Was he/she dazed or did he/she have a gap in his/her memory from the injury? ¿Se sintió él/ella aturdido, o tuvo lapsos de memoria  por causa de la lesión? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_3d.Description: How old was he/she? ¿Qué edad tenía?

tbi_4.Description: Has your child ever injured his/her head or neck in a fight, from being hit by something, or from being shaken violently? Has your child ever been shot in the head? ¿Su niño/a alguna vez se ha lastimado la cabeza o el cuello en una pelea, al recibir un golpe de algún objeto  o porque lo/la hayan sacudido con violencia? ¿Su niño(a) alguna vez ha recibido un disparo en la cabeza? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_4b.Description: Was he/she knocked out or did he/she lose consciousness (LOC)? If yes, how long? ¿Estuvo él o ella noqueado/a o perdió el conocimiento? ¿Si la respuesta es si, por cuánto tiempo? | 0 = No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento; 1 = < 30min < 30min; 2 = 30min-24hrs 30min-24hrs; 3 = >24 hrs >24 hrs

Levels.0: No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_4c.Description: Was he/she dazed or did he/she have a gap in his/her memory from the injury? ¿Se sintió él/ella aturdido, o tuvo lapsos de memoria  por causa de la lesión? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_4d.Description: How old was he/she? ¿Qué edad tenía?

tbi_5.Description: Has your child ever been nearby when an explosion or blast has occurred? ¿Su niño/a alguna vez ha estado cerca de una explosión o un estallido? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_5b.Description: Was he/she knocked out or did he/she lose consciousness (LOC)? If yes, how long? ¿Estuvo él o ella noqueado/a o perdió el conocimiento? ¿Si la respuesta es si, por cuánto tiempo? | 0 = No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento; 1 = < 30min < 30min; 2 = 30min-24hrs 30min-24hrs; 3 = >24 hrs >24 hrs

Levels.0: No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_5c.Description: Was he/she dazed or did he/she have a gap in his/her memory from the injury? ¿Se sintió él/ella aturdido, o tuvo lapsos de memoria  por causa de la lesión? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_5d.Description: How old was he/she? ¿Qué edad tenía?

tbi_6o.Description: Do you want to report any more injuries with LOC? ¿Quisiera reportar otras lesiones que hayan resultado en la pérdida de conocimiento? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_6p.Description: If yes, how many more? ¿Si la respuesta fue sí, cuantas más?

tbi_6q.Description: How many minutes was the longest knock out? ¿Cuántos minutos duró el tiempo más largo que estuvo inconsciente?

tbi_6r.Description: How many were more than or equal to 30 min? ¿Cuántas veces ha estado inconsciente por ≥ 30 min o más?

tbi_6s.Description: What was their youngest age? ¿A qué edad fue la primera vez que estuvo inconsciente?

tbi_7a.Description: Did your child experience a period of time in his/her life when he/she experienced multiple, repeated impacts to the head? (e.g., abused, contact sports) ¿Hubo algún período en la vida de su niño/a en el que haya recibido golpes o impactos múltiples y repetidos a la cabeza (p. ej., abuso infantil, deportes de contacto)? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_7c1.Description: Was he/she knocked out or did he/she lose consciousness (LOC)? If yes, how long? ¿Estuvo él o ella noqueado/a o perdió el conocimiento? ¿Si la respuesta es si, por cuánto tiempo? | 0 = No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento; 1 = < 30min < 30min; 2 = 30min-24hrs 30min-24hrs; 3 = >24 hrs >24 hrs

Levels.0: No LOC Sin pérdida de conocimiento

tbl_7c2.Description: Was he/she dazed or did he/she have a gap in his/her memory from the injury? ¿Se sintió él/ella aturdido, o tuvo lapsos de memoria  por causa de la lesión? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_7e.Description: At what age did these effects begin? ¿A qué edad comenzaron estos efectos?

tbi_7f.Description: At what age did these effects end? ¿A qué edad terminaron estos efectos?

tbi_7g.Description: Was there another instance where your child experienced a period of time in his/her life when he/she experienced multiple, repeated impacts to the head? ¿Hubo algún otro período en la vida de su niño(a) en el que haya recibido golpes o impactos múltiples y repetidos a la cabeza? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_7i.Description: What was the typical effect of the injury? Cuál fue el efecto típico de la lesión? | 1 = Dazed/memory gap; 2 = LOC pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_7k.Description: At what age did these effects begin? ¿A qué edad comenzaron estos efectos?

tbi_7l.Description: At what age did these effects end? ¿A qué edad terminaron estos efectos?

tbi_8g.Description: Was there another instance where your child experienced a period of time in his/her life when he/she experienced multiple, repeated impacts to the head? | 1 = Yes Si; 0 = No No

tbi_8i.Description: What was the typical effect of the injury? Cuál fue el efecto típico de la lesión? | 1 = Dazed/memory gap; 2 = LOC pérdida de conocimiento

tbi_8k.Description: At what age did these effects begin? ¿A qué edad comenzaron estos efectos?

tbi_8l.Description: At what age did these effects end? ¿A qué edad terminaron estos efectos?

tbi_ss_ntbiloc.Description: Number of TBI-LOC (number of TBIs with loss consciousness): SUM(AND([tbi_1]=1,[tbi_1b]>0), AND([tbi_2]=1,[tbi_2b]>0,AND([tbi_3]=1,[tbi_3b]>0),AND([tbi_4]=1,[tbi_4b]>0),AND([tbi_5]=1,[tbi_5b]>0),[tbi_6p], AND([tbi_7a]=1,[tbi_7c1]>0), AND([tbi_7g]=1,[tbi_7i]=1), AND([tbi_8g]=1,[tbi_8i]=1)); Validation: No minimum | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_ntbiloc_nm.Description: Number of TBI-LOC: Number Missing Answers

tbi_ss_ntbiloc30.Description: Number of TBI-LOC >= 30 (number of TBIs with loss of conscioiusness >= 30 minutes): SUM(AND([tbi_1]=1,[tbi_1b]>1), AND([tbi_2]=1,[tbi_2b]>1)AND(tbi_3]=1,[tbi_3b]>1),  AND([tbi_4]=1,[tbi_4b]>1),AND([tbi_5]=1,[tbi_5b]>1),[tbi_6r], AND([tbi_7a]=1,[7c1]>1));  Validation: No minimum | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_ntbiloc30_nm.Description: Number of TBI_LOC >= 30: Number Missing  Answers

tbi_ss_nmrpi.Description: Number of periods with multiple or repeated injuries: SUM([tbi_7a],[tbi_7g],[tbi_8g]);  Validation: No minimum | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_nmrpi_nm.Description: Number of periods with multiple or repeated injuries:  Number Missing  Answers

tbi_ss_agefirst.Description: Age at first TBI-LOC:  IF(OR(AND([tbi_1]=1,[tbi_1b]>0),AND([tbi_2]=1,[tbi_2b]>0),AND([tbi_3]=1,[tbi_3b]>0), AND([tbi_4]=1,[tbi_4b]>0),AND([tbi_5]=1,[tbi_5b]>0),[tbi_6o]=1,AND([tbi_7a]=1,[tbi_7c1]>0), AND([tbi_7g]=1,[tbi_7i]=1),AND([tbi_8g]=1,[tbi_8i]=1)), MIN([tbi_1d],[tbi_2d],[tbi_3d],[tbi_4d],[tbi_5d],[tbi_6s],[tbi_7e],[tbi_7k],[tbi_8k]),"");  Validation: No minimum | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_agefirst_nm.Description: Age at first TBI-LOC:  Number Missing Answers

tbi_ss_before15.Description: TBI-LOC before age 15 | Bogner, J. A., G. G. Whiteneck, et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst1.Description: Worst injury1: improbable TBI (No TBI) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst1b.Description: Worst injury1b: improbable TBI complex  (TBI without LOC or memory loss) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst2.Description: Worst Injury2: possible mild TBI  (TBI without LOC but memory loss) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst3.Description: Worst Injury3: Mild TBI (TBI with LOC less than or equal to 30 m) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst4.Description: Worst Injury4: moderate TBI (TBI with LOC 30 m - 24 h) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst5.Description: Worst Injury5: Severe TBI (TBI with LOC greater than or equal to 24 h) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_ss_worst_overall.Description: Worst Injury Overall: Worst TBI - 1, Improbable TBI (no TBI or TBI w/o LOC or memory loss); 2, Possible mild TBI (TBI w/o LOC but memory loss); 3, Mild TBI (TBI w/LOC ≤ 30 min); 4, Moderate TBI (TBI w/LOC  30 min - 24 hrs); 5, Severe TBI (TBI w/ LOC ≥ 24 hrs) | Bogner, J. A., Whiteneck, G. G.,  et al. (2017)  Test-Retest Reliability of Traumatic Brain Injury Outcome Measures: A Traumatic Brain Injury Model Systems Study.  J Head Trauma Rehabil  32(5): E1-E16.

tbi_8.Description: The next question asks about concussions. A concussion is when a blow or jolt to the head causes problems such as headaches, dizziness, being dazed or confused, difficulty remembering or concentrating, vomiting, blurred vision, or being knocked out. Since we last saw on you [asnt_timestamp_c], how many times did your child have a concussion from playing a sport or being physically active? | 0=0 times ; 1=1 time ; 2=2 times ; 3=3 times ; 4=4 or more times [event-name] = '4_year_follow_up_y_arm_1'

tbi_ss_ntbiloc_l.Description: Number of TBI-LOC (number of TBIs with loss consciousness): SUM(AND([tbi_1]=1,[tbi_1b]>0), AND([tbi_2]=1,[tbi_2b]>0,AND([tbi_3]=1,[tbi_3b]>0),AND([tbi_4]=1,[tbi_4b]>0),AND([tbi_5]=1,[tbi_5b]>0),[tbi_6p], AND([tbi_7a]=1,[tbi_7c1]>0)); Validation: No minimum

tbi_ss_ntbiloc30_l.Description: Number of TBI-LOC >= 30 (number of TBIs with loss of conscioiusness >= 30 minutes): SUM(AND([tbi_1]=1,[tbi_1b]>1), AND([tbi_2]=1,[tbi_2b]>1)AND(tbi_3]=1,[tbi_3b]>1), AND([tbi_4]=1,[tbi_4b]>1),AND([tbi_5]=1,[tbi_5b]>1),[tbi_6r], AND([tbi_7a]=1,[7c1]>1)); Validation: No minimum

tbi_ss_nmrpi_l.Description: Number of periods with multiple or repeated injuries: SUM([tbi_7a]); Validation: No minimum

Number of periods with multiple or repeated injuries
: Number missing

tbi_ss_worst_overall_l.Description: Worst Injury Overall: Worst TBI - 1, Improbable  TBI (no TBI or TBI w/o LOC or memory loss); 2, Possible mild TBI (TBI w/o LOC but memory loss); 3, Mild TBI (TBI w/LOC ≤ 30 min); 4, Moderate TBI (TBI w/LOC  30 min - 24 hrs); 5, Severe TBI (TBI w/ LOC ≥ 24 hrs) | 1 = 1.  Improbable  TBI; 2 = 2.  Improbable TBI complex; 3 = 3. Mild TBI; 4 = 4. Moderate TBI; 5 = 5. Severe TBI

Worst injury1b = improbable TBI complex
